If you exclude the fact that every government in the US has been using SS to fund general spending for quite a while (Nixon Admin?), the Clinton surplus was due to higher levels of income tax collected then the during the Bush Administration. 
 
 Without using the SS surplus there would be a minimum of an extra 75 billion dollar shortfall in government revenues. Government revenues during the last 6 years of the Clinton administration increased dramatically ( Tech bubble helped alot). During the Bush adminstration, revenues decreased and as of 2004 have not matched 2000 levels.

Assuming when looking at the US budget the term Trust Fund generally is for Social Security with some other odds and end within it.
 
 For Clintons year (1994) 95 billion dollars went from trust fund into general spending. Changing a budget deficit from 298billion to 203 billion.
 
 For 2000, 234 billion from the Trust fund went to general spending providing changing the surpus of 1.5 billion  to 236 billion.
 
 That was the only year that a true surplus was run  during the Clinton admin.
 
 For 2004 if the Trust fund money was not used the US would have run a budget deficit of 605 billion dollars instead of the reported 412 billion
